definitions: To refuse (a loan, insurance, etc.) to someone because they live in an area deemed to be a poor financial risk.
To draw a red line through (something, such as a budget item) to indicate disapproval or deletion.
To operate an engine at or beyond its maximum safe RPM.
To mark or indicate with a red line.
examples: Banks were accused of redlining certain neighborhoods.
He loves to redline his car on the track.
Please redline any errors you find.
